option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Unity Projects/Devotaria":"{\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/RoomNodeTypeListSO.cs\":\"This file defines a `RoomNodeTypeListSO` class, which is a ScriptableObject that holds a list of `RoomNodeTypeSO` objects. The purpose of this class is to provide a centralized list of all the room node types used in the game, which can be easily edited in the Unity editor.\\n\\n`RoomNodeTypeListSO`: A ScriptableObject that holds a list of `RoomNodeTypeSO` objects, which represent the different types of rooms used in the game.\\n\\n`OnValidate()`: A function that is called when the `RoomNodeTypeListSO` object is validated, and it ensures that the list of `RoomNodeTypeSO` objects is not empty.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Attributes/ReadOnlyAttribute.cs\":\"This file defines a custom attribute called `ReadOnlyAttribute` that can be used to mark a property as read-only in the Unity Editor.\\n\\n`ReadOnlyAttribute`: A custom property attribute that can be used to mark a property as read-only in the Unity Editor.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Editor/ReadOnlyDrawer.cs\":\"This file contains a single class and two functions:\\n\\n`ReadOnlyDrawer`: A custom property drawer for the `ReadOnlyAttribute` in Unity, which ensures that the property it is applied to is displayed as read-only in the Unity Inspector.\\n\\n`OnGUI`: Overrides the default `OnGUI` method to draw the property field as read-only, adjusting the label width for boolean properties to prevent overlap.\\n\\n`GetPropertyHeight`: Overrides the default `GetPropertyHeight` method to return the same height as the original property field.\\n\\nThis file provides a custom property drawer implementation that allows Unity developers to easily mark certain properties as read-only in the Inspector, without the need for additional scripting.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/RoomNodeSO.cs\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `RoomNodeSO` class, which is a ScriptableObject that represents a node in a room node graph. The class handles the logic for creating, connecting, and managing room nodes in a game\\u0027s level design.\\n\\n`RoomNodeSO`: A ScriptableObject that represents a node in a room node graph, with properties and methods for managing the node\\u0027s connections, selection, and visual representation.\\n\\n`Initialize(Rect, RoomNodeGraphSO, RoomNodeTypeSO)`: Initializes the room node with a position, a reference to the room node graph, and a room node type.\\n\\n`Draw(GUIStyle)`: Draws the room node in the Unity editor using the provided GUI style.\\n\\n`ProcessEvents(Event)`: Handles various mouse events (down, up, drag) and updates the node\\u0027s selection state accordingly.\\n\\n`AddChildRoomNodeConnection(string)`: Adds a child node connection to the current node, validating the connection and maintaining the bidirectional relationship.\\n\\n`RemoveChildRoomNodeConnection(string)`: Removes a child node connection from the current node, maintaining the bidirectional relationship.\\n\\n`RemoveAllNodeConnections()`: Removes all parent and child node connections from the current node.\\n\\n`IsChildRoomValid(string)`: Checks if a given child node can be connected to the current node, based on various structural and compatibility rules.\\n\\n`IsChildNodeStructurallyValid(string, RoomNodeSO)`: Checks if a given child node is structurally valid to be connected to the current node.\\n\\n`AreRoomTypesCompatible(RoomNodeSO)`: Checks if the room types of the current node and the given child node are compatible for a connection.\",\"/Assets/TempAssets/Tilemap/CustomBrushScripts/CoordinateBrush/Editor/CoordinateBrush.cs\":\"`CoordinateBrush`: A custom grid brush that allows the user to paint, erase, and flood fill tiles at a specific z-coordinate.\\n\\n`CoordinateBrush.Paint(GridLayout, GameObject, Vector3Int)`: Paints the brush at the specified position with the z-coordinate set by the `z` variable.\\n`CoordinateBrush.Erase(GridLayout, GameObject, Vector3Int)`: Erases the brush at the specified position with the z-coordinate set by the `z` variable.\\n`CoordinateBrush.FloodFill(GridLayout, GameObject, Vector3Int)`: Flood fills the brush at the specified position with the z-coordinate set by the `z` variable.\\n`CoordinateBrush.BoxFill(GridLayout, GameObject, BoundsInt)`: Fills a box with the brush at the specified position with the z-coordinate set by the `z` variable.\\n\\n`CoordinateBrushEditor`: A custom editor for the `CoordinateBrush` class that provides a preview of the brush and displays the position and size of the brush in the scene view.\\n\\n`CoordinateBrushEditor.PaintPreview(GridLayout, GameObject, Vector3Int)`: Provides a preview of the brush at the specified position with the z-coordinate set by the `z` variable.\\n`CoordinateBrushEditor.OnPaintSceneGUI(GridLayout, GameObject, BoundsInt, GridBrushBase.Tool, bool)`: Displays the position and size of the brush in the scene view, with the z-coordinate set by the `z` variable.\",\"/Packages/packages-lock.json\":\"This file appears to be a Unity package manifest, which lists the dependencies and their versions required for a Unity project. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides a detailed list of the packages and modules that are part of the project, including their versions and dependencies. This information is crucial for ensuring that the project can be properly built and run on different development environments.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/Editor/GraphUndoActionManager.cs\":\"This file contains a single class, `GraphUndoActionManager`, which is responsible for managing the undo/redo functionality of a room node graph in a Unity game engine application.\\n\\n`GraphUndoActionManager`: Manages the undo/redo actions for a room node graph, including adding, deleting, and changing nodes and connections.\\n\\n`RecordAddNodeAction`: Records an action for adding a new node to the graph.\\n`RecordDeleteNodeAction`: Records an action for deleting an existing node from the graph.\\n`RecordAddConnectionAction`: Records an action for adding a new connection between two nodes.\\n`RecordDeleteConnectionAction`: Records an action for deleting an existing connection between two nodes.\\n`RecordChangeNodeTypeAction`: Records an action for changing the type of an existing node.\\n`PushUndoAction`: Pushes an undo action to the undo stack, maintaining a maximum of 3 actions.\\n`PerformUndo`: Performs the undo operation for the last action on the undo stack.\\n`UndoAddNode`: Undoes an add node action by deleting the node.\\n`UndoDeleteNode`: Undoes a delete node action by recreating the node.\\n`UndoAddConnection`: Undoes an add connection action by removing the connection.\\n`UndoDeleteConnection`: Undoes a delete connection action by recreating the connection.\\n`UndoChangeNodeType`: Undoes a node type change action by restoring the previous type.\",\"/ProjectSettings/SceneTemplateSettings.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON object that contains information about dependency types and their default instantiation modes in a Unity project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a list of dependency type information and a default dependency type information.\\n\\nHere\\u0027s a summary of the contents:\\n\\n`templatePinStates`: An empty array for template pin states.\\n`dependencyTypeInfos`: An array of objects that describe various dependency types and their default instantiation modes, such as `UnityEngine.AnimationClip`, `UnityEditor.Animations.AnimatorController`, `UnityEngine.Material`, and more.\\n`defaultDependencyTypeInfo`: An object that describes the default dependency type information, with a type of `\\u003cdefault_scene_template_dependencies\\u003e` and a default instantiation mode of 1.\\n`newSceneOverride`: An integer value that likely represents an override for creating a new scene.\\n\\nOverall, this file appears to be a configuration file that defines the default dependency types and their instantiation modes for a Unity project.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/Editor/UndoAction.cs\":\"This file defines two classes:\\n\\n`UndoActionType`: An enumeration that represents different types of actions that can be undone in a node graph.\\n\\n`UndoAction`: A class that stores information needed to undo a graph modification, including the type of action, node details, connection details, and previous/new node types.\\n\\nThe file is part of the `NodeGraph.Editor` namespace and provides a way to manage undo/redo functionality for a node-based graph system.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/RoomNodeTypeSO.cs\":\"This file defines a single class, `RoomNodeTypeSO`, which is a ScriptableObject that represents a type of room node in a dungeon game. The class has several boolean properties that indicate the characteristics of the room node type, such as whether it should be displayed in the editor, whether it is a corridor, entrance, or boss room, and whether it is unassigned.\\n\\n`RoomNodeTypeSO`: A ScriptableObject that represents a type of room node in a dungeon game, with properties that define its characteristics.\\n\\n`OnValidate()`: A function that validates the `roomNodeTypeName` property to ensure it is not empty.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Utilities/HelperUtilities.cs\":\"This file contains a static class `HelperUtilities` with two utility functions:\\n\\n`HelperUtilities`: A static class that provides utility functions for validating string and enumerable values.\\n\\n`ValidateCheckEmptyString`: Checks if a given string is empty and logs a message if it is.\\n\\n`ValidateCheckEnumerableValues`: Checks if a given enumerable contains any null values or is empty, and logs a message if either condition is true.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/Editor/RoomNodeGraphEditor.cs\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`RoomNodeGraphEditor`: Represents a custom editor window for managing Room Node Graphs, allowing users to create, edit, and manage room node graphs for dungeon or level design in Unity.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`OpenWindow()`: Defines where the editor window will be created in the Unity menu.\\n\\n`OnDoubleClickAsset(int instanceID, int line)`: Opens the room node graph editor window if a room node graph SO asset is double-clicked in the inspector.\\n\\n`DrawBackgroundGrid(float gridSize, float gridOpacity, Color gridColor)`: Draws a background grid for the room node graph editor.\\n\\n`ProcessEvents(Event currentEvent)`: Handles input events for the room node graph editor window, including key presses, mouse interactions, and determining the active room node or graph-level actions.\\n\\n`ProcessRoomNodeGraphMouseEvents(Event currentEvent)`: Processes mouse events for the room node graph editor, such as mouse down, mouse up, and mouse drag.\\n\\n`ShowContextMenu(Vector2 mousePosition)`: Displays a context menu at the specified mouse position, providing options for actions such as adding room nodes, selecting all room nodes, and deleting selected room node links.\\n\\n`AddRoomNode(object mousePositionObject, RoomNodeTypeSO roomNodeType, bool recordUndo \\u003d true)`: Adds a new room node at the mouse position and with the specified room node type.\\n\\n`DeleteSelectedRoomNodes()`: Deletes the currently selected room nodes from the room node graph, excluding entrance nodes.\\n\\n`DrawRoomNodes()`: Renders all room nodes in the current Room Node Graph using the assigned node styles.\\n\\n`GetHoveredRoomNode(Event currentEvent)`: Returns the room node that is currently being hovered over by the mouse.\\n\\n`ClearAllSelectedRoomNodes()`: Clears the selection state of all currently selected room nodes in the room node graph.\\n\\n`SelectAllRoomNodes()`: Selects all room nodes in the current Room Node Graph and marks them as selected.\\n\\n`DrawRoomConnections()`: Draws visual connection lines between parent room nodes and their child room nodes in the currently selected RoomNodeGraph.\\n\\n`DrawDraggedLine()`: Draws a bezier line representing a connection being dragged from a room node to the current mouse position, if applicable.\\n\\n`ClearLineDrag()`: Clears the connection line.\\n\\n`TrySelectConnectionLine(Vector2 mousePosition)`: Tries to select a connection line at the given mouse position.\\n\\n`GetDistanceFromPointToLineSegment(Vector2 point, Vector2 lineStart, Vector2 lineEnd)`: Calculates the distance from a point to a line segment.\\n\\n`ClearSelectedConnections()`: Clears all selected connection lines.\\n\\n`DeleteSelectedConnections()`: Deletes all currently selected connection lines.\\n\\n`DrawUndoInfo()`: Draws undo information at the top of the editor window.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/RoomNodeGraphSO.cs\":\"This file defines a `RoomNodeGraphSO` class, which is a ScriptableObject that represents a graph of room nodes for a dungeon in a Unity game. The file also includes some editor-specific code for working with the graph in the Unity editor.\\n\\n`RoomNodeGraphSO`: A ScriptableObject that represents a graph of room nodes for a dungeon in a Unity game.\\n\\n`LoadRoomNodeDictionary()`: Populates a dictionary with the room nodes in the graph.\\n\\n`GetRoomNode(string roomNodeID)`: Returns the room node with the specified ID, or `null` if the ID is empty.\\n\\n`OnValidate()`: Repopulates the room node dictionary when the ScriptableObject is edited in the Unity editor.\\n\\n`SetNodeToDrawConnectionLineFrom(RoomNodeSO roomNode, Vector2 position)`: Sets the room node and position to draw a connection line from in the Unity editor.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/NodeGraph/Editor/GraphStateSnapshot.cs\":\"This file contains a single class, `GraphStateSnapshot`, which represents a snapshot of the state of a graph for undo operations.\\n\\n`GraphStateSnapshot`: Represents a snapshot of the graph state for undo operations.\\n\\n`GraphStateSnapshot(RoomNodeGraphSO graph)`: Initializes a `GraphStateSnapshot` instance by capturing the current state of the provided `RoomNodeGraphSO` graph.\\n\\n`NodeSnapshot`: Represents a snapshot of a single node in the graph.\\n\\n`ConnectionSnapshot`: Represents a snapshot of a single connection between two nodes in the graph.\",\"/Packages/manifest.json\":\"This file appears to be a Unity package manifest file, which defines the dependencies for a Unity project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather lists the various Unity packages and modules that the project depends on. The file specifies the versions of these packages and modules that should be used in the project.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/GameManager/GameResources.cs\":\"This file defines a `GameResources` class that serves as a singleton for managing game resources, specifically the `RoomNodeTypeListSO` object, which is likely used for dungeon generation or management.\\n\\n`GameResources`: A singleton class that provides access to game resources, specifically the `RoomNodeTypeListSO` object.\\n\\n`Instance`: A static property that returns the singleton instance of the `GameResources` class, creating it if it doesn\\u0027t already exist.\",\"/Assets/Scripts/Misc/Settings.cs\":\"This file contains a single static class named `Misc.Settings` that holds a constant value for the maximum number of child corridors leading from a room in a dungeon building system.\\n\\n`Misc.Settings`: A static class that holds settings related to the construction of rooms and corridors in a dungeon building system.\\n\\n`maxChildCorridors`: A constant that specifies the maximum number of child corridors that can lead from a room, with a note that this value is not recommended to be set higher than 3 as it can cause the dungeon building process to fail.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a heading for a document titled \\\"Devotaria\\\". There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file seems to be the start of a document, but without any additional content, it is difficult to summarize what the file does.\"}"}
